page.title: 01Pembrey Gazetteer (1)
page.content: Pembrey, Penbre in Welsh,which means 'the end of the hill',has a{population {of about 6,000,of whom 30% are Welsh {speaking.}Welsh is still the main language of its church and two chapels. It has{one hotel, five public {houses, four shops(two grocery, one {newsagent and one electrical), two {sales and repair garages, post office, {a primary school} and {Community {Centre}(owned and managed by Dyfed Education Authority) which provides a variety of non-vocational courses for adults and young people (Youth Club). Situated on the western edge of the highly urbanised Llanelli area, Pembrey is primarily rural but with a small industrial estate of light industries such as, video assembly, contract building products, and pre- fabricated metal units.
